components.description:
A snake, a slithering reptile without limbs. Generally depicted as a yellowish-green snake facing left, with a long, coiled body and flicking a red, forked tongue.

May be used for various metaphorical senses of snake.

One of the 12 animals of the Chinese zodiac. May also be used in association with ‚õé Ophiuchus, the Serpent-Bearer, sometimes considered a 13th sign of the Western zodiac.

Samsung’s snake was previously facing forward.
components.title: Snake

May be used for various metaphorical senses of snake.

One of the 12 animals of the Chinese zodiac. May also be used in association with ‚õé Ophiuchus, the Serpent-Bearer, sometimes considered a 13th sign of the Western zodiac.

title: Snake

version.description:
Released in October 2010, Unicode 6.0 was the first version of the Unicode Standard to support emoji.

Some characters in prior versions of Unicode were retroactively updated to provide an emoji presentation. This release was the first to introduce new characters for the sole purpose of compatability with emojis being used in Japan.

emoji_net_data.category: Miscellaneous Symbols And Pictographs -> Animal symbols
emoji_net_data.definition: A green, coiled snake sticking out its forked tongue. Snake was approved as part of Unicode 6.0 in 2010 and added to Emoji 1.0 in 2015. Copy http://emojipedia.org/snake/
emoji_net_data.name: snake

bn:00089343v: To utter with a hissing sound.
Make a sharp hissing sound, as if to show disapproval
To speak with a hissing sound

bn:00034953n: A fricative sound (especially as an expression of disapproval)
An expression of disapproval made to sound like the noise of a snake.

bn:00059150n: Snakes are elongated, legless, carnivorous reptiles of the suborder Serpentes that can be distinguished from legless lizards by their lack of eyelids and external ears.
Limbless scaly elongate reptile; some are venomous
Any reptile of the suborder Serpentes, typically having a scaly cylindrical limbless body, fused eyelids, and a jaw modified for swallowing large prey.

bn:00032050n: Evil, in a general context, is taken as the absence or complete opposite of that which is ascribed as being good.
The quality or state of being evil.
Evil is a term used to indicate acts or qualities involving needless or wanton harm or destruction, or the deliberate violation of some accepted moral codes of behavior.
The quality of being morally wrong in principle or practice

apple_vendor_description: The snake emoji on Apple devices slithers with a smooth, sinuous form, its scales rendered with meticulous detail and a subtle, iridescent sheen. Apple's design language brings this creature to life with realistic lighting and glossy 3D shading, giving it a vibrant, almost tangible presence. Whether symbolizing cunning, transformation, or a more literal interpretation, this emoji evokes a sense of intrigue and primal energy, presented with the polished aesthetic characteristic of Apple‚Äôs emoji collection.
